name: Snow Golem
immune: cold, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Cold Absorption
text: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Melt
text: While in an area of extreme heat, the golem loses 1d6 hit points at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The golem makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

action.name: Snowball
text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) cold damage.

description:
A snow golem is a mass of snow brought to life through magic. Nonmagical weapons pass through its snowy form without dealing any appreciable damage to it, though heat is its doom.
Source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 308
